meanings.definition: To speak or write at length or in detail.
meanings.sent1: During the presentation, the professor expatiated on the topic for over an hour.
meanings.sent2: She expatiated on her favorite book, describing every character in great detail.
meanings.sent3: The children expatiated on their adventures at the playground, making it sound like a grand expedition.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling skills were so captivating that it felt like he expatiated with a magical pen.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide expatiated on the history of the ancient ruins, painting a vivid picture in our minds.

meanings.definition: To enlarge in discourse or writing; be copious in description or discussion.
meanings.sent1: The author expatiated on the setting of the story, describing every detail of the landscape.
meanings.sent2: They expatiated on the benefits of the new technology during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The chef expatiated on the flavors of the dish, making everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was so contagious that she expatiated on her upcoming vacation plans.
meanings.sent5: The artist expatiated on the colors of the painting, creating a vibrant masterpiece in words.
